english: reed; bulrush; (in 葫芦) gourd; reed plant

etymology.description: semantic: 艹 “plant” + phonetic: 户 (hù) [simplified]; semantic: 艹 “plant” + phonetic: 盧 (OC *b·raː) [traditional]
etymology.interpretation: 艹 marks it as a plant, while the phonetic component supplies the sound value toward lú. Traditional writes the phonetic as 盧, and the simplified form replaces it with the simpler 户, preserving pronunciation and category.
etymology.simplification: Replaced the complex phonetic 盧 with the simpler 户 in the 盧-phonetic series (e.g., 蘆→芦), reducing strokes while keeping the reading and meaning.

examples.chinese: 河边长满了芦苇(河邊長滿了蘆葦)。
examples.english: Reeds grow thick along the riverbank.

examples.chinese: 他用芦笙演奏民歌(他用蘆笙演奏民歌)。
examples.english: He played folk songs on the lusheng (reed-pipe).

examples.chinese: 我们买了一个葫芦(我們買了一個葫蘆)。
